articles.content: We only just put Apple's iPhone 17 launch event behind us, but Bloomberg's Mark Gurman is already glancing into his crystal ball to see what's next for the company. In today's Power On newsletter Gurman says that there are at least 10 more products from Apple that are expected to launch either later this year or in the first half of 2026. articles.content: A great mobile phone doesn‚Äôt need to cost a fortune. In 2025, features once exclusive to high-end devices ‚Äì big batteries, multi-camera arrays, high refresh rate OLED displays and more ‚Äì have trickled down to more affordable models. Sure, you‚Äôll still need to buy a flagship smartphone to get the best camera or fastest processor, but you don‚Äôt need to compromise nearly as much anymore if you‚Äôre looking for a great handset at a reasonable price. articles.content: It's been over one year since Intuit shut down the popular budgeting app Mint. I was a Mint user for many years; millions of other users like me enjoyed how easily Mint allowed us to track all accounts in one place and monitor credit scores. I also used it regularly to help me track spending, set goals like pay my mortgage down faster and with general money management. articles.content: Another day, another adorable game that I've become completely obsessed with.
